channel.title: Need Help in general
channel.description:
Ok first, I use testscape source spliced with snippets from other servers, but even with the blank testsape source, the server crashes very very often, it sais something about the npc handler and item handler in the server report. how do i fix this.
Second, I cannon spawn or add monsters manualy, if i do then they have 0 health and freeze the host pc up and log off the main admin when attacked, how do i fix this?
Third, when spawned, which coords do i use to make them walk?

item.title: Need Help in general
item.dc:creator: @nathan173 nathan173
item.description:
@nathan173 wrote:

it quit a simple problem i had that problem testscape is quite alot ofr am so u probaly need 2 get double memory well thats what i did and it worked

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help in general
item.dc:creator: @dracar dracar
item.description:
@dracar wrote:

the monsters work now, thats great, still having trouble making em walk… tehre a cirtain diagonal distance teh coords have to be?[br][size=1]Posted on: December 27, 2006, 12:26:38 AM[/size][hr]well just in case anyone ever reads this, i found out its not what fedexer said,
---------x2,y2
| |
| |
| |
x1,y1-------

its this
---------x1,y1
| |
| |
| |
x2,y2-------

item.title: Need Help in general
item.dc:creator: @fedexer -fedexer-
item.description:
@fedexer wrote:

they make a square… so this is how it looks

---------x2,y2
| |
| |
| |
x1,y1-------

so the x1 and y1 are the bottom left corner of the area they can walk in, and the x2 and y2 are the top right corner of the area they can walk in, so all together it makes a square of where they are allowed to walk inside of

Read full topic

item.title: Need Help in general
item.dc:creator: @fedexer -fedexer-
item.description:
@fedexer wrote:

ok not sure about the first error,

for the second error you have for the npc’s crashing your server you should go to the npc.cfg in your server file, and find the npc you have added… and you will see something like this…

[code]npc = 0 Hans 0 0[code]

the first number is the npc id, the second word is what the npc is called, the 3rd number is the npc’s combat level and the last number is the npc’s health

you must make sure the npc has atleast 1 health before you add it to your server or it will crash it when attacked… this is your problem so just find your npc and change the last 0 … to any amount of health

and for the third question , i normally just choose one more up from the original x coord and one more up from the original y coord

hope that helps

-fedexer-[/code][/code]

Read full topic
